sn10.5:10.3: This is, I think, the only case in the EBTs where “inferno” might be suggested for _naraka_. Elsewhere in early Pali, however, it means “cliff, abyss” ([mn49:5.9](), mn86:6.15](), [snp3.11:28.4](), [thag16.8:4.2]()).
sn10.5:11.1: It seems that here we see the origin of bhadanta = bhante, i.e. “good luck to thee”
sn10.5:11.4: Phrasing as a question is suggested by CAF R-D tran. Otherwise I can’t make sense of “bhanda” in the previous line.
